Draw a line (line\\_3) from point [0.75, 0.2753] to point [0.0, 0.2753]. 4. Draw a line (line\\_4) from point [0.0, 0.2753] to point [0.0, 0.0]. Scale the 2D sketch After creating the sketch, you need to scale the sketch using the scaling parameter sketch\\_scale provided in the CAD Assembly JSON: * Scaling Parameter: 0.75 Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch Now, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector provided in the CAD Assembly JSON: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Extrude the 2D sketch to create the 3D shape Finally, extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector with these properties: * Depth towards normal: 0.0816 * Depth opposite normal: 0.0 As the last step, you may now construct a new solid body using the completed 3D shape. This part, which is rectangular prism with a sloped side, is 0.75 units in length (x-axis), 0.75 units in width (y-axis), and 0.0816 units in height (z-axis), completing the first step in building the final shape.</description>
